ETEC 510 GROUP PROJECT

JAM-X: Gamification and Dyslexia

Welcome to JAM-X!

This site targets educators of grades 2-4 students who are learning about Canada’s Métis population. We designed a game called JAM-X which was created with an intention to provide diverse learners, students with dyslexia, with an opportunity to engage with their learning in a fun and meaningful way. Centred around frameworks of Universal Design for Learning (UDL) and constructivism our intention is to support young learners by providing them with more opportunities for success, while ensuring they are included in regular classroom activities.

On this page, you’ll be able to access our four learning modules, our user guide, and a feedback page to help us improve JAM-X. We recommend that users visit our User Guide before accessing our game, to learn how JAM-X supports learning for students with dyslexia.

Disclaimer

We are not Doctors and JAM-X does not claim to cure dyslexia. This game is meant for students in grades 2-4 who are learning about social studies. JAM-X is meant to support in-class instruction by providing learners with additional practice with the material they are engaging in.
